info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 5:37PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Churchill and northern Lyon Counties through 615 PM PDT... At 533 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms near and south of Fallon, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Very heavy rainfall, wind gusts to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Heavy rain could produce minor flooding and ponding on roads in parts of Fallon, and also along US-95 between Fallon and Schurz. Locations impacted include... Fallon, Junction U.S 50 And NV 116 (Stuart Rd), Fallon Station and Junction U.S 95 And NV 120 (Pasture Rd). MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
